meanings.sent1: She tried to nabk the last cookie before her brother could get it.
meanings.sent2: The cat tried to nabk the toy mouse from under the couch.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to nabk the acorn from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket attempted to nabk the wallet from the distracted tourist.
meanings.sent5: The quick thief was able to nabk the diamond necklace without anyone noticing.

meanings.sent1: The desert was filled with nabk, making it hard to walk barefoot.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully avoided the nabk while trimming the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The children learned to stay away from the nabk after one of them got pricked.
meanings.sent4: The nabk in the garden seemed to guard the flowers with its sharp thorns.
meanings.sent5: The hiker accidentally brushed against the nabk and got a painful scratch.

meanings.definition: A type of tree native to the Middle East
meanings.sent1: The oasis was shaded by a large nabk tree, providing relief from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The locals gathered under the nabk tree to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent3: The birds nested in the branches of the ancient nabk tree.
meanings.sent4: The fruit of the nabk tree was a favorite snack for the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The camel sought shelter under the wide canopy of the nabk tree.
